title: Overshoot
content:
**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101043844/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Terminology](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101043844/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Terminology) : Overshoot**

Applied to round characters and curved or rounded parts of characters which "over-shoot" a desired boundaries---typically the [baseline](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101043844/http:/typophile.com/wiki/baseline) and [x-line](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101043844/http:/typophile.com/wiki/x-line)--to compensate for the optical illusion of the curves under-shooting those boundaries. Most [O](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101043844/http:/typophile.com/wiki/O)s and lowercase bowl letters have an amount of overshoot in proportion to the plot of their curve. Tight curves require more overshoot than flattened and squared curves.
